title: Improper Host Detection During Team Up  on tweetdeck.twitter.com

activities.message: You can use more white characters on Malicious point like : ```%0D``` , ```%09```
activities.markdown_message: You can use more white characters on Malicious point like : %0D , %09

activities.message:
Thank you for your report.

We're having trouble following your report. When we navigate to `https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com`, we see this response:

```http
HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
connection: close
content-length: 0
date: Tue, 05 Dec 2017 23:52:35 GMT
server: tsa_a
x-connection-hash: da0fa3d0e11e6f77d44b3ac70c3a231e
x-response-time: 1
```

We see that response whether or not the victim is currently logged in to Twitter.

Can you please provide detailed reproduction steps that show the full process of implementing this attack? For example, in your video, the victim sees a warning message saying `This will add @rockaustinay as an Admin on this account`. But the URL given to the victim does not contain any information identifying `@rockaustinay` as far as I can see. What made that request valid? How was it linked to `@rockaustinay`? Any additional information you can provide will help us investigate your report.

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your report.

We're having trouble following your report. When we navigate to https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com, we see this response:

HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
connection: close
content-length: 0
date: Tue, 05 Dec 2017 23:52:35 GMT
server: tsa_a
x-connection-hash: da0fa3d0e11e6f77d44b3ac70c3a231e
x-response-time: 1

We see that response whether or not the victim is currently logged in to Twitter.

Can you please provide detailed reproduction steps that show the full process of implementing this attack? For example, in your video, the victim sees a warning message saying This will add [@rockaustinay](/rockaustinay) as an Admin on this account. But the URL given to the victim does not contain any information identifying @rockaustinay as far as I can see. What made that request valid? How was it linked to @rockaustinay? Any additional information you can provide will help us investigate your report.

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

activities.message:
Hi @bugtriage-michael 

Thanks for your quick response

Let's start the reproduction steps with fresh account(which have not yet teamed up with anyone),Suppose that fresh account is victim's account.( In my steps @rockaustinay is victim)

1. Victim must be logged in to twitter.
2. Give this link to Victim ```https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com```
3. Now victim opens this link and he will see authorization page for team up.
4. Victim enters his credentials and clicks Authorize button for team up with his other accounts.
5. Now you can see this will redirected Victim to ```google.com```.(You can use evil.com in malicious url)
6. The malicious endpoint ```authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com``` not get santised properly.

In malicious endpoint you can see i added white space ```%0A``` you can use more as: ```%0D```, ```%09```

Note: In step 4 try to authorize different account every time, for e.g: If you authorized account1 then again for reproducing the attack try to account2 instead of account1. 

I attached PoC video, Please say me if you have trouble in any step.

Best Regards
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @bugtriage-michael

Thanks for your quick response

Let's start the reproduction steps with fresh account(which have not yet teamed up with anyone),Suppose that fresh account is victim's account.( In my steps @rockaustinay is victim)

  1. Victim must be logged in to twitter.
  2. Give this link to Victim https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com
  3. Now victim opens this link and he will see authorization page for team up.
  4. Victim enters his credentials and clicks Authorize button for team up with his other accounts.
  5. Now you can see this will redirected Victim to google.com.(You can use evil.com in malicious url)
  6. The malicious endpoint authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com not get santised properly.

In malicious endpoint you can see i added white space %0A you can use more as: %0D, %09

Note: In step 4 try to authorize different account every time, for e.g: If you authorized account1 then again for reproducing the attack try to account2 instead of account1.

I attached PoC video, Please say me if you have trouble in any step.

Best Regards

activities.message:
Thank you for your reply.

We have followed these steps:

1. The victim logs in to Twitter.
2. The victim navigates to `https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com`
3. The victim provides their Twitter credentials, and clicks "Authorize".

However, we are not then redirected to google.com. Instead, we see an error page saying "You cannot contribute to yourself":

{F244864}

We see this error page even when the victim account has never attempted to go through this process before.

Can you explain where we diverged from your steps, or why we might be seeing this behavior?

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.
activities.markdown_message:
Thank you for your reply.

We have followed these steps:

  1. The victim logs in to Twitter.
  2. The victim navigates to https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com
  3. The victim provides their Twitter credentials, and clicks "Authorize".

However, we are not then redirected to google.com. Instead, we see an error page saying "You cannot contribute to yourself":

We see this error page even when the victim account has never attempted to go through this process before.

Can you explain where we diverged from your steps, or why we might be seeing this behavior?

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

activities.message:
Hi @bugtriage-michael 

Again thanks for your quick response

It seems you are trying to Authorize the same account that you currently logged in.

Kindly Please try in this way:

Take two fresh accounts: Account A, Account B (both are victim's account)

1. Log in to twitter with ```account A``` (which is victim's account).
2. Open link ```https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com```
3. Victim enters his credential of  ```account B``` (which is victim's 2nd account and he trying to team up with 1st account).
4. Victim clicks Authorize and get redirected to google.com

Please Reply if you have trouble in any step

With Best Regards

Thank you for thinking of Twitter security.

activities.message:
Thank you for your report. We believe it may be a valid security issue and will investigate it further. It could take some time to find and update the root cause for an issue, so we thank you for your patience.

Thank you for helping keep Twitter secure!

vulnerability_information_html:
Hi

Give this url https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com to any authorised user for team up and after authorization of his 2nd account he will be redirected to google.com .

First I tried to make it malicious with adding %0Agoogle.com%5C@x but it not redirected me but after adding %0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com in it, this redirected me to google.com. Which shows in this endpoint url isn't properly validating the Host after login.

Vulnerable Url: https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com

Malicious point: %0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com

PoC video attached

With Best Regards

Impact

Impact: Attacker can use this for tricking users to Phising attacks.
vulnerability_information:
Hi

Give this url ```https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com``` to any authorised user for team up and after authorization of his 2nd account he will be redirected to ```google.com``` .

First I tried to make it malicious  with adding ```%0Agoogle.com%5C@x``` but it not redirected me but after adding %0Agoogle.com%5C@x```.twitter.com``` in it, this redirected me to google.com. Which shows in this endpoint url isn't properly validating the Host after login.


Vulnerable Url: ```https://twitter.com/teams/authorize?target_screen_name=&authorize_callback=https%3A%2F%2F%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com```

Malicious point: ```%0Agoogle.com%5C@x.twitter.com```

PoC video attached

With Best Regards

## Impact

Impact: Attacker can use this for tricking users to Phising attacks.
